title: Mum denies lying about being asleep on night baby was 'smothered to death by dad'
text:

The mum of an eight-week-old baby allegedly smothered to death by her dad has denied lying about being asleep all night when the infant died, a court has heard.

Little Harper Denton was allegedly smothered to death in her sleep by her dad Kevin Eves.

The 37-year-old denies murder and grievous bodily harm with intent.

The baby was found 'purple' in a moses basket at the family home in Wixams, near Bedford, on June 12 last year, and was later pronounced dead in hospital

The trial last week heard Harper's post-mortem examination identified 34 rib fractures, 11 classic metaphyseal fractures, two fractured metatarsal bones - one in each foot - and a skull fracture.

(Image: PA Archive/PA Images)

The prosecution has alleged the injuries were inflicted over a period of at least three episodes in the three weeks leading to Harper's death.

During today's hearing, Harper's mum Cherinea Denton, 34, said she was "comatose" after taking a sleeping tablet and didn't wake until around 6am the day Harper was found, being woken by Whatsapp messages from friends.

Jo Sidhu, cross examining her at The Old Bailey, read a statement from a neighbour which said the mum-of-two had driven away from her home at around 2am.

However, Miss Denton vigorously denied being awake or leaving the house.

He said: "That was a blatant lie wasn't it?

"What were you doing out of your house, according to your neighbour? What were you doing in the middle of the night when you told this jury that you were so comatose by the tablets that you took?

"Had you done something, Miss Denton, that night that required you to steal away in the middle of the night for what appears to be a couple of hours?"

(Image: PA Archive/PA Images)



Miss Denton suggested the story had been the result of "close gossip" among neighbours and repeatedly denied being awake.

Continuing, Mr Sidhu said: "Your friend has a very different version.

"She reports a conversation with you. She says that you made some mention of events early that morning and it was along the lines of that you were messaging some uni friends when Kevin was upstairs with Harper.

"She said it was 4am.

"It was a group conversation about babies and you were flailing yourself for not being with Harper.

"What are you hiding?"

Responding, Miss Denton said: "I have nothing to hide, absolutely nothing to hide."

The trial continues.
description: Kevin Eves, 37, from Wixams, near Bedford, is  trial over the death of his eight-week-old daughter Harper Denton, who was found 'purple' in a Moses basket
